Traits.Name: Eerie Imprint
Traits.Content: The Forgotten leaves behind a faint outline of its presence, granting disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to detect it while it is not in plain sight.

Traits.Name: Spectral Presence
Traits.Content: The Forgotten has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks when in dim light or darkness, as it can blend into the shadows of reality.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The Forgotten makes three attacks: two with its Touch of Oblivion and one with its Reality Rend.

Actions.Name: Touch of Oblivion
Actions.Content: Melee Attack: +5 to hit, dealing 6 (1d8 + 2) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of its next turn.

Actions.Name: Reality Rend
Actions.Content: Melee Attack: +5 to hit, dealing 7 (1d10 + 2) psychic damage. The target must make a DC 12 Intelligence saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Actions.Name: Ethereal Dissolution
Actions.Content: The Forgotten can merge temporarily with the fabric of reality. Each creature within a 15-foot radius must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they take 15 (3d8 + 2) necrotic damage and become blinded until the end of their next turn. This ability can be used once every 3 rounds.
